7.html:
A barkeep, also known as a bartender or barmaid (depending on gender), is a person who prepares and serves alcoholic (and sometimes non-alcoholic) beverages behind a bar in a pub, tavern, restaurant, or other drinking establishment. The role of a barkeep includes a variety of tasks and responsibilities:

  1. Mixing Drinks: Barkeepers are skilled in mixing cocktails and other beverages according to recipes or customer preferences.
  2. Serving Customers: They serve drinks to customers, ensuring that everyone is attended to in a timely manner.
  3. Customer Service: Barkeepers often engage with customers, providing friendly and efficient service, and sometimes offering a listening ear or conversation.
  4. Maintaining the Bar Area: They keep the bar area clean and well-stocked, including washing glasses, restocking bottles, and organizing supplies.
  5. Handling Payments: Barkeepers manage transactions, including taking payments, giving change, and keeping track of tabs.
  6. Checking IDs: Ensuring that customers are of legal drinking age is an important part of their responsibilities.
  7. Monitoring Consumption: They also need to be aware of customers' alcohol consumption and may refuse service to those who are visibly intoxicated or disruptive.
  8. Knowledge of Beverages: Barkeepers typically have extensive knowledge of different types of alcoholic beverages, including beers, wines, and spirits, as well as the ability to make recommendations to customers.

In addition to these tasks, an experienced barkeep may also handle inventory management, create new drink recipes, and contribute to the overall atmosphere and success of the establishment.
7.text:
A barkeep, also known as a bartender or barmaid (depending on gender), is a person who prepares and serves alcoholic (and sometimes non-alcoholic) beverages behind a bar in a pub, tavern, restaurant, or other drinking establishment. The role of a barkeep includes a variety of tasks and responsibilities:

Mixing Drinks: Barkeepers are skilled in mixing cocktails and other beverages according to recipes or customer preferences.
Serving Customers: They serve drinks to customers, ensuring that everyone is attended to in a timely manner.
Customer Service: Barkeepers often engage with customers, providing friendly and efficient service, and sometimes offering a listening ear or conversation.
Maintaining the Bar Area: They keep the bar area clean and well-stocked, including washing glasses, restocking bottles, and organizing supplies.
Handling Payments: Barkeepers manage transactions, including taking payments, giving change, and keeping track of tabs.
Checking IDs: Ensuring that customers are of legal drinking age is an important part of their responsibilities.
Monitoring Consumption: They also need to be aware of customers' alcohol consumption and may refuse service to those who are visibly intoxicated or disruptive.
Knowledge of Beverages: Barkeepers typically have extensive knowledge of different types of alcoholic beverages, including beers, wines, and spirits, as well as the ability to make recommendations to customers.

In addition to these tasks, an experienced barkeep may also handle inventory management, create new drink recipes, and contribute to the overall atmosphere and success of the establishment.
7.title: What is a pubkeeper?

15.title: Track Social Media Engagement

17.html: We have a DAOhaus Social Tracking Google sheet for tracking engagement and measuring our performance.
17.text: We have a DAOhaus Social Tracking Google sheet for tracking engagement and measuring our performance.
17.title: Tools

18.html:
At the beginning of each month we need to update the spreadsheet with the data from the previous month.

  1. Open the DAOhaus Social Tracking Google sheet
  2. Add a new heading for the previous month
  3. Scroll down to the beginning of the previous month in the DAOhaus profile
  4. command+click each tweet to open it in a new tab
  5. Add the Type, Tweet, URL, Comments, Retweets, Likes, Bookmarks, and Views
  6. Repeat for each tweet that month
  7. Count the total number of T, RT, QT and add that below the months heading
  8. Add a formula to calculate the sum for each column
  9. Paste the data for that month into and the calculation script below into Chat GPT to identify the best performing tweet for that month
  10. Make the best performing tweet bold
  11. Ask Chat GPT to convert the table to Markdown and show you the code
  12. Paste the code into that month's GitHub issue related to Reporting Social Media Engagement under a Data heading (Example)
  13. Add bullets for the total amount of Tweets, Retweets, and Quote tweets
  14. Embed the best performing tweet
  15. Share the data and best performing Tweet in the üí•-news-flash channel on Discord
  16. Add social tag to GitHub issue
  17. Close the GitHub issue
18.text:
At the beginning of each month we need to update the spreadsheet with the data from the previous month.

Open the DAOhaus Social Tracking Google sheet
Add a new heading for the previous month
Scroll down to the beginning of the previous month in the DAOhaus profile
command+click each tweet to open it in a new tab
Add the Type, Tweet, URL, Comments, Retweets, Likes, Bookmarks, and Views
Repeat for each tweet that month
Count the total number of T, RT, QT and add that below the months heading
Add a formula to calculate the sum for each column
Paste the data for that month into and the calculation script below into Chat GPT to identify the best performing tweet for that month
Make the best performing tweet bold
Ask Chat GPT to convert the table to Markdown and show you the code
Paste the code into that month's GitHub issue related to Reporting Social Media Engagement under a Data heading (Example)
Add bullets for the total amount of Tweets, Retweets, and Quote tweets
Embed the best performing tweet
Share the data and best performing Tweet in the üí•-news-flash channel on Discord
Add social tag to GitHub issue
Close the GitHub issue
18.title: Procedure

19.html:
# Create a DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
 
# Define a performance metric
df["Performance"] = df["Comments"] + df["Retweets"] + df["Likes"] + df["Bookmarks"] + df["Views"]
 
# Find the tweet with the highest performance
best_performance_tweet = df.loc[df["Performance"].idxmax()]
 
best_performance_tweet
19.text:
# Create a DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
 
# Define a performance metric
df["Performance"] = df["Comments"] + df["Retweets"] + df["Likes"] + df["Bookmarks"] + df["Views"]
 
# Find the tweet with the highest performance
best_performance_tweet = df.loc[df["Performance"].idxmax()]
 
best_performance_tweet
19.title: Calculations

20.html:
Payments for PublicHaus maintenance are made using Superfluid on OP Mainnet.

Protocolooors and Platformoooors each receive 0.75 ETHx per month for their chores around the $HAUS. These funds are used at the discretion of the wearer of the Hat associated with that role. Funds are used for paying for various tasks and bounties required for keeping the $HAUS in order.
20.text:
Payments for PublicHaus maintenance are made using Superfluid on OP Mainnet.
Protocolooors and Platformoooors each receive 0.75 ETHx per month for their chores around the $HAUS. These funds are used at the discretion of the wearer of the Hat associated with that role. Funds are used for paying for various tasks and bounties required for keeping the $HAUS in order.
20.title: Make Payments From Superfluid

22.html:
Superfluid uses a combination of Super ETH (ETHx) and Constant Inflow NFTs (CIF) to make their magic.

  • Protocolooors
  • Platformoooors
22.text:
Superfluid uses a combination of Super ETH (ETHx) and Constant Inflow NFTs (CIF) to make their magic.

Protocolooors
Platformoooors
22.title: Streams

24.html:
1. Open Gnosis Safe of stream Receiver
  • Protocolooors
  • Platformoooors
  1. Goto Apps > Superfluid
  2. Navigate to Wrap/Unwrap
  3. Click Unwrap tab
  4. Enter amount of ETHx to unwrap
  5. Click Unwrap button
  6. Confirm Transaction
  7. Execute Transaction
  8. Finish

Once the is uwrapped you should see the Ether in the balance under the Assets item in the Gnosis Safe wallet.
24.text:
Open Gnosis Safe of stream Receiver


Protocolooors
Platformoooors


Goto Apps > Superfluid
Navigate to Wrap/Unwrap
Click Unwrap tab
Enter amount of ETHx to unwrap
Click Unwrap button
Confirm Transaction
Execute Transaction
Finish

Once the is uwrapped you should see the Ether in the balance under the Assets item in the Gnosis Safe wallet.
24.title: Unwrap ETHx

25.html:
1. Goto Assets item in Gnosis Safe
  2. Hover over Ether
  3. Click the Send button
  4. Enter Recipient address on OP Mainnet
  5. Enter Amount
  6. Click Next
  7. Sign
  8. Execute
  9. Finish

Verify funds were received in your EOA or notify the recipient. Share message on Discord to inform the DAO a payment was made.

Verify funds were received in your EOA or notify the recipient. Share message on Discord to inform the DAO a payment was made.

26.html:
Facilitating Demo Day demands a bold and spirited approach to guarantee an event that celebrates our community's graft and achievements. The facilitator, acting as the Master of Ceremonies (MC), is responsible for keeping the crowd engaged, maintaining a lively atmosphere, and ensuring the event stays on schedule. Here's what's needed:

  • Start Event on Discord
  • Welcome attendees
  • Set the stage with an introduction to the season's Objectives
  • Spill what you‚Äôre hyped about
  • Introduce each project
  • Stir up questions and keep the dialogue gritty
  • Wrap it up with a bang
  • Tease brilliance of the coming season
26.text:
Facilitating Demo Day demands a bold and spirited approach to guarantee an event that celebrates our community's graft and achievements. The facilitator, acting as the Master of Ceremonies (MC), is responsible for keeping the crowd engaged, maintaining a lively atmosphere, and ensuring the event stays on schedule. Here's what's needed:

Welcome attendees

Spill what you‚Äôre hyped about

Stir up questions and keep the dialogue gritty
Wrap it up with a bang

26.title: Facilitate Demo Day

27.html:
As the MC, you‚Äôre the heartbeat of the event, like a rogue in a rowdy tavern. Your role is to ensure that:

  • We hit our marks so every project gets its spotlight.
  • The atmosphere is celebratory.
  • Participants feel valued and fired up.

By following these steps, we can ensure a Demo Day that‚Äôs as unforgettable as the community that built it. Let‚Äôs show ‚Äòem what we‚Äôre made of and revel in our shared chaos and creativity.

28.title: Publish Demo Day

31.html:
• Install/update OBS Studio
  • Set up scene
    • Add Discord application (this is finnicky and may need to be re-selected between sessions) and fit to recording area (trim as needed for privacy)
    • Add "Audio Output Capture"
    • If you add local microphone (not needed) mute it as the use of multiple devices will have your voice coming through the output capture
  • Ensure enough disk space for length of recording (~1GB/hr)
  • Adjust volume levels and test the scene
  • If this is your first time, run a short test record to verify setup
31.text:
Install/update OBS Studio
Set up scene

Add Discord application (this is finnicky and may need to be re-selected between sessions) and fit to recording area (trim as needed for privacy)
Add "Audio Output Capture"
If you add local microphone (not needed) mute it as the use of multiple devices will have your voice coming through the output capture


Ensure enough disk space for length of recording (~1GB/hr)
Adjust volume levels and test the scene
If this is your first time, run a short test record to verify setup
31.title: OBS

32.html:
• Create alt account (or use existing)
    • Log in with this account on recording machine, stay on mute
    • Join server you plan to record, ensure channel access
    • Log in with normal account on another device
    • This is done so that recorder can talk without fiddling with OBS (and still be recorded)
32.text:
Create alt account (or use existing)

Log in with this account on recording machine, stay on mute
Join server you plan to record, ensure channel access
Log in with normal account on another device
This is done so that recorder can talk without fiddling with OBS (and still be recorded)
32.title: Discord

33.html:
• Optionally switch to streamer mode on Discord (this might be automatic)
  • Ask host to let you know when to start and stop recording
    • Start when host says so
    • Stop when finished

35.html: We have a quarterly Demo Day for DAOhaus. This event is to share the work completed in the season. The work should be related to the season's objectives but anything community members shipped and want to share is fair game. It is a time catch up and celebrate our accomplishments.
35.text: We have a quarterly Demo Day for DAOhaus. This event is to share the work completed in the season. The work should be related to the season's objectives but anything community members shipped and want to share is fair game. It is a time catch up and celebrate our accomplishments.
35.title: Schedule Demo Day

36.html:
Schedule Demo Day during the last Community Camp meeting of the current season. Create a Discord event and forum discussion.

  • Channel: open-haus
  • Event Topic: Season # Demo Day
  • Start Date: Last Tuesday of season
  • Start Time: 15:00 CDT
Description:

Join us for Season # Demo Day, a ritual gathering where our community comes together to showcase and celebrate the work we have accomplished this season. Whether it aligns with our seasonal objectives or it's a passion project that shipped, it's all fair game. This is our time to catch up, support each other, and revel in our collective spirit. Let's make some noise and show what DAOhaus is all about!

Cover Image:

38.html:
Create a forum post for community members to share links to their projects and discuss the work completed. Community members should share what they are proud of as well as what was difficult and what failed. This is an opportunity to support and learn from each other. A way to share insights to inspire future collaboration and avoid common pitfalls

  • Channel: üìú-public-forum

New Post

Title: Shipped in Season #

Message:

As we gear up for Season # Demo Day, we want to hear from you! Share links to your projects and let's discuss the the work we shipped. Tell us what you're proud of, what challenges you faced, and what didn't go as planned. This is a chance to support and learn from each other, gain insights to inspire future collaborations, and help us avoid common pitfalls.

Tags: Retro

43.html:
Once the proposal for the Retro Signal Session has been executed and the Demo Day video has been published we can add the choices for retro rewards.

Additional choices can be added by the community but adding the projects from Demo Day encourages participation and shows appreciation.

  • Goto Signals
  • Click the session
43.text:
Once the proposal for the Retro Signal Session has been executed and the Demo Day video has been published we can add the choices for retro rewards.
Additional choices can be added by the community but adding the projects from Demo Day encourages participation and shows appreciation.

Goto Signals
Click the session
43.title: Add Retro Rewards Choices

44.html:
For each project presented in Demo Day:

  1. Click Add Choice
  2. Fill out the form

  • Choice Title: Name of project
  • Choice Description (markdown): Brief description of project
  • Link: Link to site or app
  • YouTube (share link): Link to chapter related to project in Demo Day video
  • Imgur (Link to image png, jpg, gif): Use something like ImgBB to upload a screenshot of the site or app and add the URL
  1. Click Submit
  2. Repeat
  3. Share

Fill out the form



Choice Title: Name of project

Link: Link to site or app
YouTube (share link): Link to chapter related to project in Demo Day video
Imgur (Link to image png, jpg, gif): Use something like ImgBB to upload a screenshot of the site or app and add the URL


Click Submit
Repeat

44.title: Add Choices

45.html:
Retro Signal Sessions reward contributors for work completed in a season that supports the DAOs priorities from the Objective Signal Session.

The Retro Signal Session is a two week event that happens at the end of each quarter.

The proposal to Create a Signal TCR should be submitted 14 days before the end of the month. The end date of the proposal should be set for the last day of the month. It is helpful to add an event on the calendar to provide a reminder to start this process.

  • Voting Period: 4 days
  • Grace Period: 3 days
  • Retro Signal Session: 7 days
45.text:
Retro Signal Sessions reward contributors for work completed in a season that supports the DAOs priorities from the Objective Signal Session.
The Retro Signal Session is a two week event that happens at the end of each quarter.
The proposal to Create a Signal TCR should be submitted 14 days before the end of the month. The end date of the proposal should be set for the last day of the month. It is helpful to add an event on the calendar to provide a reminder to start this process.

Voting Period: 4 days
Grace Period: 3 days
Retro Signal Session: 7 days
45.title: Create Retro Signal Session

47.html:
Staking in the DAO should be paused prior to starting the Retro Signal Session.

To verify staking is paused goto Stake HAUS and confirm the following banner is displayed:

You can also verify staking is paused in the targetDAO.tsx file on GitHub.
47.text:
Staking in the DAO should be paused prior to starting the Retro Signal Session.
To verify staking is paused goto Stake HAUS and confirm the following banner is displayed:

You can also verify staking is paused in the targetDAO.tsx file on GitHub.
47.title: Verify Staking is Paused

48.html:
If staking is not currently paused you need to take the following steps to pause staking prior to starting the Retro Signal Session:

  1. Goto targetDAO.tsx on GitHub.
  2. Click pencil icon to "Edit this file"
  3. Change:
STAKE_PAUSED: false,

to:

STAKE_PAUSED: true,
48.text:
If staking is not currently paused you need to take the following steps to pause staking prior to starting the Retro Signal Session:

Goto targetDAO.tsx on GitHub.
Click pencil icon to "Edit this file"
Change:

STAKE_PAUSED: false,
to:
STAKE_PAUSED: true,
48.title: Pause Staking

49.html:
1. Use dEth Tools to get the date on the first of next month when staking should resume.

  1. Copy the Unix epoch (in miliseconds):
  2. Edit the Unix epoch
    • Since the epoch is in miliseconds you will need to remove 3 zeros from the end
    • Change: 1088640000000
    • To: 1088640000
  3. Paste your updated Unix epoch in dEth Tools to verify it is correct:

  1. Go back to the targetDAO.tsx file you are editing on GitHub.
  2. Change:
STAKE_NEXT_START: 1711976936; // last end 1704222000, //

to:

STAKE_NEXT_START: 1088640000; // last end 1711976936, //

(notice you take the previous Epoch time and replace last end comment and paste the new time as STAKE_NEXT_START)

  1. Click commit changes
  2. Add Extended description: "Pause staking and update date for resuming"
  3. Select "Create a new branch for this commit and start a pull request"
  4. Name branch: earth2travis-retro5 (your GitHub username dash current retro number)

  1. Open a pull request
  2. Create pull request
  3. Merge pull request
  4. Delete branch

* Need to verify how these changes are deployed and if there are additional steps required

Once the changes have been deployed verify the staking is paused banner appears on Stake Haus

<INSERT SCREENSHOT>

Select "Create a new branch for this commit and start a pull request"
Name branch: earth2travis-retro5 (your GitHub username dash current retro number)



Open a pull request

Merge pull request
Delete branch

* Need to verify how these changes are deployed and if there are additional steps required
Once the changes have been deployed verify the staking is paused banner appears on Stake Haus

@PublicHaus WTF did you ship in Season #?
51.title: Create Forum Post on Discord

52.html:
1. Goto PublicHAUS (HQ) Signals
  2. Click Create Signal (at bottom of view)
  • Signal Title: Public HAUS Retro #5 (update retro number to current season)
  • Signal Description: Signal your appreciation to the builders that keep the HAUS standing. Projectooooors, Bizdevooooooors, Maintainooooors, Operatoooooors, Proposalooooooors, and Champions
  • End Date: Last day of month at 11:30 PM
  • Link: Link to Discord Forum post created above
  • Tags: retro, season 5 (update season number to current season)
  1. Click Submit
  2. Vote on Proposal
52.text:
Goto PublicHAUS (HQ) Signals
Click Create Signal (at bottom of view)


Signal Title: Public HAUS Retro #5
(update retro number to current season)
Signal Description: Signal your appreciation to the builders that keep the HAUS standing. Projectooooors, Bizdevooooooors, Maintainooooors, Operatoooooors, Proposalooooooors, and Champions
End Date: Last day of month at 11:30 PM
Link: Link to Discord Forum post created above
Tags: retro, season 5
(update season number to current season)


Click Submit
Vote on Proposal
52.title: Create Signal

54.html:
To add the event to Signals the Create a Signal TCR proposal associated with the seasons retro rewards needs to be executed.

  1. Goto Proposals
  2. View Details of the proposal
  3. Click Execute
  4. Add Choices
54.text:
To add the event to Signals the Create a Signal TCR proposal associated with the seasons retro rewards needs to be executed.

Goto Proposals
View Details of the proposal
Click Execute
Add Choices
54.title: Execute Retro Rewards Proposal

55.html:
Once the proposal for the Retro Signal Session has been executed and the choices from Demo Day have been added the community needs to be notified.

  • Click the session on Signals
  • Verify the choices have been added
  • Click the session and copy URL
55.text:
Once the proposal for the Retro Signal Session has been executed and the choices from Demo Day have been added the community needs to be notified.

Click the session on Signals
Verify the choices have been added
Click the session and copy URL
